comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: I guess it depends on whether you're looking from an individual perspective or the whole system. The way I see it, the Trust System is decentralized for people using the forum. Â Each user can change their own trust lists however they want, adding or removing members as they please and Â this shapes how they view trust feedback on their end. Â But zooming out to look at everything you could say parts of it are still kinda centralized. Â There's central authority that can boot members from DT1, although they still have the right to vote. Â Quote from: Bitcoin SV on November 30, 2023, 11:42:14 AMHow can decentralized decision making be instantaneous? Only a centralized decision can be so instantaneousThat is not correct. The Bitcoin system is decentralized and operates on a consensus mechanism, allowing for near-instantaneous decision-making. This decision-making process occurs approximately every ten minutes, resulting in block confirmations and subsequent updates to the Bitcoin ledger.
